style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%;text-decoration:underline">PHILIP MORRIS INTERNATIONAL INC. (PMI) REPORTS 2022 FOURTH-QUARTER</font></div><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%;text-decoration:underline">AND FULL-YEAR RESULTS&#59;</font></div><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%;text-decoration:underline">2022 FULL-YEAR REPORTED DILUTED EPS OF $5.81, ADJUSTED DILUTED EPS OF $5.98 AND ADJUSTED DILUTED EPS EXCLUDING RUSSIA AND UKRAINE OF $5.34,</font></div><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%;text-decoration:underline">REPRESENTING CURRENCY-NEUTRAL GROWTH OF 11.9%&#59;</font></div><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%;text-decoration:underline">PROVIDES 2023 EPS FORECAST</font></div><div id="if35dd73cdf9149249a054c07087a72f3_7"></div><div style="text-align:center"><font><br></font></div><div id="if35dd73cdf9149249a054c07087a72f3_10"></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">STAMFORD, CT, February 9, 2023 &#8211; Philip Morris International Inc. (NYSE&#58; PM) today announces its 2022 fourth-quarter and full-year results. Growth rates presented in this press release on an organic basis reflect adjusted results, excluding currency, acquisitions and disposals. Given the impact of the War in Ukraine on the company&#8217;s operations in Russia and Ukraine in 2022, PMI is also providing figures and comparisons excluding the company&#8217;s operations in these two markets for all historical periods. To provide more clarity on the full extent of the company's business in 2023, PMI will include both Ukraine and Russia in its 2023 forecast and adjusted reporting. A glossary of key terms, definitions and explanatory notes is included at the end of this press release. Adjustments, other calculations and reconciliations to the most directly comparable U.S. GAAP measures are included in the schedules to this press release.</font></div><div style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">(0.3)%</font></td><td colspan="3" style="background-color:#ffffff;padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="background-color:#ffffff;padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="background-color:#ffffff;padding:2px 1pt;text-align:center;vertical-align:middle"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">11.9%</font></td><td colspan="3" style="background-color:#ffffff;padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:middle"><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:6.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;position:relative;top:-3.5pt;vertical-align:baseline">(b)</font></div></td></tr><tr><td colspan="18" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:middle"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">(a) On an organic basis<br>(b) Excluding currency<br>Note&#58; &#34;RU&#34; stands for Russia&#59; &#34;UA&#34; stands for Ukraine</font></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Full-Year</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Net revenues from smoke-free products accounted for 32.1% of total net revenues, or 31.3% excluding Russia and Ukraine. Following the acquisition of Swedish Match, PMI defines &#8220;smoke-free products&#8221; to </font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div><font><br></font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">include all Swedish Match products other than Swedish Match&#8217;s combustible tobacco products, in addition to PMI's heat-not-burn, e-vapor, oral nicotine, and wellness and healthcare products.</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Market share for heated tobacco units (HTUs) in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> markets up by 1.1 points to 8.0%, or by 1.4 points to 7.9% excluding Russia and Ukraine</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Increased regular quarterly dividend by 1.6% to $1.27 per share, or an annualized rate of $5.08 per share</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Fourth-Quarter</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Net revenues from smoke-free products accounted for 36.0% of total net revenues, or 35.6% excluding Russia and Ukraine</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Market share for HTUs in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> markets up by 1.4 points to 8.5%, or up by 1.8 points to 8.5% excluding Russia and Ukraine</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Total </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> users at quarter-end estimated at approximately 24.9 million, of which approximately 17.8 million had switched to </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> and stopped smoking (approximately 20.3 million and 14.2 million, respectively, excluding Russia and Ukraine)</font></div><div id="if35dd73cdf9149249a054c07087a72f3_16"></div><div style="margin-top:15pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#34;Despite the challenging operating environment in 2022, due to the war in Ukraine, as well as supply-chain and global inflationary pressures, we delivered very strong full-year adjusted results led by the continued growth of IQOS and a robust performance in the combustible tobacco category,&#34; said Jacek Olczak, Chief Executive Officer.</font></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#34;We are well on our way to becoming a majority smoke-free company, with smoke-free products accounting for almost one-third of our total net revenues for the year. With the acquisition of Swedish Match and the agreement to take full control of IQOS in the U.S. in April 2024, we achieved two important milestones in our smoke-free transformation in 2022 and are well positioned to accelerate this journey.&#34;</font></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#34;We enter 2023 as a truly global smoke-free champion, with two of the industry's leading smoke-free brands, IQOS and ZYN, and continued innovation across our broader smoke-free product portfolio. For the year, we forecast organic top-line growth of 7% to 8.5% and currency-neutral adjusted diluted EPS growth of 7% to 9%, despite inflationary pressures and transitory impacts related to ILUMA deployment.&#34;</font></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#34;For Swedish Match, we expect continued strong growth from the business in 2023, following a very strong finish to the year, led by ZYN in the U.S.&#34;</font></div><div id="if35dd73cdf9149249a054c07087a72f3_25"></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">2022 FULL-YEAR SUMMARY</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Unless otherwise noted, all references to performance in this section exclude Russia and Ukraine</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted net revenues increased by 7.7% in organic terms, primarily driven by total shipment volume growth of 3.2% (marking the second consecutive year of growth), the continued favorable mix shift from cigarettes to smoke-free products, and a favorable total pricing variance.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Smoke-free product net revenues increased by 18.0% on an organic basis, mainly driven by HTU shipment volume growth of 21.5%, partly offset by lower device revenues.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Combustible tobacco product adjusted net revenues increased by 3.7% on an organic basis, driven by a favorable pricing variance of approximately 4% and a cigarette shipment volume increase of 0.8%. International cigarette category share increased by 0.3 points to 24.9% despite the impact of </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> cannibalization, including a 0.2 point increase for </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Marlboro</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">.</font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 2 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted operating income margin declined by 0.6 points on an organic basis, primarily reflecting lower gross margins due mainly to&#58; (i) inflationary pressures on cost of sales, (ii) the adverse profitability impact of accelerated switching to </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">ILUMA </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">devices, (iii) the higher initial cost of </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">ILUMA</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> devices and related HTUs&#59; and (iv) higher air freight costs due to supply chain disruptions related to the war in Ukraine. The pressures at the gross margin level were partly offset by the favorable product mix impact of growing HTU volume at higher unit margins, as well as pricing and productivities. The benefits of operating cost efficiencies and operating leverage further offset the gross margin headwinds.  </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted diluted EPS of $5.34 increased by 11.9%, excluding currency. Including Russia and Ukraine, adjusted diluted EPS of $5.98 increased by 10.1% on a currency-neutral basis.</font></div><div id="if35dd73cdf9149249a054c07087a72f3_28"></div><div 36 for additional information. </font></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Reported diluted EPS is forecast to be in a range of $6.09 to $6.21, at prevailing exchange rates, versus reported diluted EPS of $5.81 in 2022. Excluding a total 2023 adjustment of $0.16 per share and an adverse currency impact, at prevailing exchange rates, of $0.15 per share, this forecast represents a projected increase of 7% to 9% versus adjusted diluted EPS of $5.98 in 2022, as outlined in the above table.</font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 3 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">2023 Full-Year Forecast Assumptions</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">This forecast assumes&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">The full contribution of the company's operations in Russia and Ukraine for the entire year. In Russia, the environment for divestment has become increasingly challenging and complex (see &#34;War in Ukraine&#34; section on page 6). To provide more clarity on the full extent of PMI's business, the company will include both Russia and Ukraine in its 2023 forecast and adjusted reporting.</font></div><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:54pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.46pt">For forecasted 2023 excise surcharges, a favorable ruling would equate, on a full-year basis, to an estimated one percentage point increase in net revenues and three percentage point increase in adjusted diluted EPS, with operating cash flow moving toward the top half of the company's corresponding assumption range outlined below&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:54pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font share, which includes amortization related to the Swedish Match acquisition based on preliminary purchase price allocation that may be subject to change&#59;</font></div><div including related interest expense, with Swedish Match included in PMI's organic performance as of November 11, 2023&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font borrowings excluding Swedish Match-related financing, notably reflecting higher borrowing costs on refinanced debt&#59;</font></div><div 21.5%&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font to year-end working capital requirements&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font investments behind smoke-free product manufacturing capacity, including for </font><font certain margin pressures that are skewed to the first-half, timing factors related to shipments and cost saving, and tougher first-half comparisons versus 2022&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">First-quarter reported diluted EPS in a range of $1.28 to $1.33, including an unfavorable currency impact, at prevailing exchange rates, of $0.10 per share, notably reflecting&#58; HTU shipment volume of around 26 to 28 billion units, low single-digit organic top-line growth and soft margins relative to the full year.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Factors described in the Forward-Looking and Cautionary Statements section of this release represent continuing risks to these projections.</font></div><div id="if35dd73cdf9149249a054c07087a72f3_37"></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Swedish Match AB Acquisition</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">On November 11, 2022, Philip Morris Holland Holdings B.V. (&#8220;PMHH&#8221;), a wholly owned subsidiary of PMI, acquired a controlling interest of 85.87% of the total issued and outstanding shares in Swedish Match. Swedish Match's operating results beginning on November 11, 2022, through December 31, 2022, are included in PMI's consolidated statement of earnings and disclosed as a separate segment.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">On November 28, 2022, PMHH announced that it had acquired 93.11% of the shares in Swedish Match and intended to&#58; (i) initiate compulsory redemption under the Swedish Companies Act to acquire all remaining shares in the company&#59; and (ii) request delisting of Swedish Match&#8217;s shares from Nasdaq Stockholm.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">On December 16, 2022, Swedish Match announced that the compulsory redemption process had been initiated. On December 30, 2022, the shares of Swedish Match were delisted from Nasdaq Stockholm, by which time PMHH had become the owner of 94.81% of the company's shares.</font></div><div id="if35dd73cdf9149249a054c07087a72f3_34"></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">New Regional Structure</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">In November 2022, PMI announced a change in the company&#8217;s regional structure -- to four regions, from six -- to further support the growth of its smoke-free business, reinforce consumer centricity, and increase the speed of innovation and deployment, all in alignment with its ambition of becoming a majority smoke-free business by net revenues by 2025. The change to its regional operations was completed in January 2023.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI will report its financial results based on the new regional structure as of the first quarter of 2023. In March 2023, the company plans to disclose select historical financial information for the 2020 to 2022 period based on the new regional structure.</font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 5 -</font></div></div></div><div id="if35dd73cdf9149249a054c07087a72f3_1347"></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">KT&#38;G Agreements</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">On January 30, 2023, PMI announced a long-term collaboration with KT&#38;G, South Korea&#8217;s leading tobacco and nicotine manufacturer, to continue to commercialize KT&#38;G&#8217;s innovative smoke-free devices and consumables on an exclusive, worldwide basis (excluding South Korea). </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The agreement covers fifteen years, to January 29, 2038, with performance-review cycles and associated commitments, based on volume, to be confirmed for each three-year period, to allow flexibility for evolving market conditions.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The agreement gives PMI continued exclusive access to KT&#38;G&#8217;s smoke-free brands and product-innovation pipeline, including offerings for low- and middle-income markets, that will enhance PMI&#8217;s existing portfolio of smoke-free products. </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Products sold under the agreement will be subject to assessment to ensure they meet the regulatory requirements in the markets where they are launched, as well as PMI&#8217;s high standards of quality and scientific substantiation. PMI and KT&#38;G will seek any necessary regulatory approvals that may be required on a market-by-market basis.</font></div><div id="if35dd73cdf9149249a054c07087a72f3_40"></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">War in Ukraine</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Since the onset of the war in Ukraine, PMI's main priority has been the safety and security of its more than 1,300 employees and their families in the country. The company has helped to evacuate more than 1,000 people from Ukraine and relocate over 2,700 others from conflict zones to locations in the country away from the heaviest fighting&#59; provided critical aid to employees who cannot leave or who decide to remain in Ukraine&#59; and provided those who have left the country with a range of support in neighboring countries. The company is continuing to pay salaries to all its Ukrainian employees and is also providing substantial in-kind support to them and their families. In addition, PMI has contributed approximately $10 million in funds and donated essential items across the country.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">On February 25, 2022, in order to preserve the safety of its employees, PMI announced the temporary suspension of its commercial and manufacturing operations in Ukraine, including at its factory, in Kharkiv. The company subsequently resumed some retail activities where safety allowed, in order to provide product availability and service to adult consumers, and began to supply the market from production centers outside Ukraine, as well as through a contract manufacturing arrangement. Production at the company's factory in Kharkiv remains suspended.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">As of December 31, 2022, PMI's Ukrainian operations have approximately $0.4 billion in total assets, excluding intercompany balances.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">On March 24, 2022, PMI announced the concrete steps it had taken to suspend planned investments and scale down its manufacturing operations in Russia.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI is continuously assessing the evolving situation in Russia, including&#58; recent regulatory constraints in the market that entail very complex terms and conditions that must be met for any divestment transaction to be granted approval by the authorities&#59; and restrictions resulting from international regulations.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">As of December 31, 2022, PMI's Russian operations have approximately $2.5 billion in total assets, excluding intercompany balances, of which approximately $0.6 billion consisted of cash and equivalents held mostly in local currency (Russian rubles).</font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 6 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI recorded pre-tax charges related to the war in Ukraine of approximately $23 million in the fourth quarter of 2022 and approximately $151 million in the full year (including humanitarian efforts). This includes charges in Russia related to the cancellation of the planned launch of </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">ILUMA</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> and the planned production of related HTUs.</font></div><div id="if35dd73cdf9149249a054c07087a72f3_46"></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Conference Call</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">A conference call, hosted by Jacek Olczak, Chief Executive Officer, and Emmanuel Babeau, Chief Financial Officer, will be webcast at 9&#58;00 a.m., Eastern Time, on February 9, 2023. Access the call at </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;text-decoration:underline">www.pmi.com&#47;2022Q4earnings</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">.</font></div><div id="if35dd73cdf9149249a054c07087a72f3_49"></div><div style="margin-top:15pt;text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">TOTAL MARKET, CONSOLIDATED SHIPMENT VOLUME &#38; MARKET SHARE</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Total Market</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Full-year estimated international industry cigarette and heated tobacco unit volume (excluding China and the U.S.) of 2.6 trillion, increased by 0.2%, driven by the EU, South &#38; Southeast Asia and Americas Regions, partly offset by the Eastern Europe, Middle East &#38; Africa and East Asia &#38; Australia Regions, as described in the Regional sections.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Excluding Russia and Ukraine, full-year estimated international industry volume increased by 0.9%. </font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 7 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Consolidated Shipment Volume</font></div><div 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">%</font></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-top:1pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Full-Year</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Shipment Volume</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's total shipment volume increased by 1.6%, driven by an increase of 14.9% for HTUs, partly offset by a 0.5% decline for cigarettes.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Excluding Russia and Ukraine, PMI's total shipment volume increased by 3.2%, as detailed in Appendix 3, reflecting increases of 21.5% and 0.8% for HTUs and cigarettes, respectively. PMI's total shipment volume in the Eastern Europe Region increased by 2.7%, on the same basis, as shown in Appendix 4.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">For additional detail on PMI's shipment volume performance by Region, please refer to the &#34;Total Market, PMI Shipment &#38; Market Share Commentaries&#34; sections for PMI's regional operating segments.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Impact of Inventory Movements</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%"> </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The net unfavorable impact of estimated distributor inventory movements was immaterial in the year, with PMI&#8217;s total in-market sales increasing by 1.7%, or by 3.2% excluding Russia and Ukraine -- both essentially in-line with the respective shipment volumes.</font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 8 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's total HTU in-market sales volume for the year was 106.9 billion units, or 86.4 billion units excluding Russia and Ukraine, representing growth of 15.6% and 21.4%, respectively.</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Fourth-Quarter </font></div><div style="margin-top:1pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's total shipment volume increased by 1.2%, driven by a 26.1% increase in HTU shipments, partly offset by a 2.8% decline in cigarette shipments.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Excluding Russia and Ukraine, PMI's total shipment volume increased by 2.6%, as detailed in Appendix 3, reflecting a 37.5% increase for HTUs, partly offset by a 2.2% decrease for cigarettes. PMI's total shipment volume in the Eastern Europe Region increased by 3.2%, on the same basis, as shown in Appendix 4. </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">For additional detail on PMI's shipment volume performance by Region, please refer to the &#34;Total Market, PMI Shipment &#38; Market Share Commentaries&#34; sections for PMI's regional operating segments.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Impact of Inventory Movements </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The net unfavorable impact of estimated distributor inventory movements was immaterial in the quarter, with PMI&#8217;s total in-market sales increasing by 1.5%, or by 2.7% excluding Russia and Ukraine -- both essentially in-line with the respective shipment volumes.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's total HTU in-market sales volume in the quarter was 28.4 billion units, or 23.2 billion units excluding Russia and Ukraine, representing growth of 20.3% and 28.1%, respectively.</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">PMI Shipment Volume by Brand</font></div><div style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">, primarily due to the EU, Eastern Europe and South &#38; Southeast Asia Regions, partly offset by the Middle East &#38; Africa and Americas Regions&#59; and</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Philip Morris</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">, mainly due to the Eastern Europe and Americas Regions, partly offset by the East Asia &#38; Australia Region.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The cigarette shipment volume decline for &#34;Others&#34; was mainly due to&#58; </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Bond Street</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> (primarily Eastern Europe) and </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Lark</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> (mainly Japan and Turkey), partly offset by </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Dji Sam Soe</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> (Indonesia).</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Excluding Russia and Ukraine, PMI's cigarette shipment volume increased by 1.8% for </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Marlboro</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">, 5.6% for </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Chesterfield</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">, 10.3% for </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Parliament</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> and 6.3% for </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Philip Morris</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">, and decreased by 0.3% for </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">L&#38;M</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">.</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Fourth-Quarter </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font Africa and East Asia &#38; Australia Regions, partly offset by the Eastern Europe Region. </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font increased&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font favorable volume&#47;mix, primarily driven by higher HTU volume and device volume, partly offset by lower cigarette volume and unfavorable device mix, cigarette mix and HTU mix&#59; a favorable pricing variance, driven by higher combustible tobacco pricing, partly offset by lower device pricing and lower HTU (net) pricing&#59; and a favorable comparison </font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 12 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:7pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">related to the Saudi Arabia customs assessments of $246 million in 2021, shown in &#34;Cost&#47;Other&#34;. Adjusted net revenues increased by 7.1% on an organic basis.</font></div><div style="margin-top:7pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">For the year, Russia and Ukraine accounted for around 8% of PMI's total net revenues. Excluding Russia and Ukraine, adjusted net revenues increased by 7.7% on an organic basis, as detailed in Schedule 11.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Operating income increased by 6.7%, excluding currency and acquisitions. Adjusted operating income increased by 5.4% on an organic basis, mainly reflecting&#58; favorable volume&#47;mix, primarily driven by higher HTU volume, partly offset by lower cigarette volume, unfavorable cigarette mix, HTU mix and device mix, and the unfavorable impact on profitability of higher device volume&#59; and a favorable pricing variance&#59; partially offset by higher manufacturing costs (primarily due to higher logistics costs and other inflationary impacts, partly offset by productivity)&#59; and higher marketing, administration and research costs. Adjusted operating income margin decreased by 0.7 points on an organic basis. </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Excluding Russia and Ukraine, adjusted operating income increased by 6.2% on an organic basis, while adjusted operating income margin decreased by 0.6 points, on the same basis, as detailed in Schedule 11.</font></div><div style="margin-top:1pt;text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:7pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Net revenues increased by 7.5% on an organic basis, mainly reflecting&#58; favorable volume&#47;mix, primarily driven by higher HTU volume and higher device volume, partly offset by lower cigarette volume and unfavorable HTU mix&#59; </font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 13 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:7pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">and a favorable pricing variance, driven by higher combustible tobacco pricing, partly offset by lower HTU (net) pricing and lower device pricing.</font></div><div style="margin-top:7pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">For the quarter, Russia and Ukraine accounted for nearly 9% of PMI's total net revenues. Excluding Russia and Ukraine, net revenues increased by 7.9% on an organic basis, as detailed in Schedule 11.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Operating income increased by 14.0%, excluding currency and acquisitions, partly reflecting the impact of 2022 items associated with the Swedish Match AB offer.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted operating income increased by 7.5% on an organic basis, mainly reflecting&#58; favorable volume&#47;mix, primarily driven by higher HTU volume, partly offset by lower cigarette volume, unfavorable HTU mix and unfavorable cigarette mix&#59; and a favorable pricing variance&#59; partially offset by higher manufacturing costs (mainly due to higher logistics costs and other inflationary impacts, partly offset by productivity)&#59; and higher marketing, administration and research costs. Adjusted operating income margin was stable on an organic basis.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Excluding Russia and Ukraine, adjusted operating income increased by 10.3% on an organic basis, while adjusted operating income margin increased by 0.8 point, on the same basis, as detailed in Schedule 11.</font></div><div id="if35dd73cdf9149249a054c07087a72f3_55"></div><div style="margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Net revenues increased by 10.6% on an organic basis, reflecting&#58; favorable volume&#47;mix, mainly driven by higher HTU volume and device volume, partly offset by lower cigarette volume, unfavorable HTU mix, and unfavorable cigarette mix&#59; partially offset by an unfavorable pricing variance, mainly due to lower HTU (net) pricing and lower device pricing, partly offset by higher combustible tobacco pricing.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Operating income increased by 10.5%, excluding currency and acquisitions. Adjusted operating income increased by 10.1% on an organic basis, primarily reflecting&#58; favorable volume&#47;mix, mainly driven by higher HTU volume, partly offset by lower cigarette volume, unfavorable HTU mix, unfavorable cigarette mix and the unfavorable impact on profitability of higher device volume&#59; partially offset by an unfavorable pricing variance&#59; </font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 14 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">higher manufacturing costs&#59; and higher marketing, administration and research costs. Adjusted operating income margin decreased by 0.3 points on an organic basis.</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Fourth-Quarter</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt"><table style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Net revenues increased by 11.2% on an organic basis, reflecting&#58; favorable volume&#47;mix, mainly driven by higher HTU volume and higher device volume, partly offset by lower cigarette volume&#59; partially offset by an unfavorable pricing variance, primarily due to lower HTU (net) pricing, partly offset by higher combustible tobacco pricing.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Operating income increased by 23.2%, excluding currency and acquisitions. Adjusted operating income increased by 16.9% on an organic basis, primarily reflecting&#58; favorable volume&#47;mix, mainly driven by higher HTU volume, partly offset by lower cigarette volume&#59; and lower marketing, administration and research costs&#59; partially offset by an unfavorable pricing variance&#59; and higher manufacturing costs. Adjusted operating income margin increased by 2.3 points on an organic basis.</font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Note&#58; Sum may not foot due to roundings.</font></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Full-Year</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The estimated total market in the EU increased by 1.1% to 484.3 billion units, primarily driven by&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Italy, up by 3.4%, mainly reflecting the impact on adult smoker average daily consumption of the easing of pandemic-related measures (particularly in the first half of the year)&#59;</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Poland, up by 13.0%, primarily reflecting a lower estimated prevalence of illicit trade, as well as higher border sales (largely due to the easing of pandemic-related measures)&#59; and</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Romania, up by 8.2%, mainly reflecting a lower estimated prevalence of illicit trade, as well as higher border sales (largely due to the easing of pandemic-related measures)&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">partly offset by</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Germany, down by 5.1%, primarily reflecting the impact of excise tax-driven price increases and higher cross-border (non-domestic) purchases due to the easing of pandemic-related measures&#59; and</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">the U.K., down by 13.4%, notably reflecting the impact of increased out-bound tourism compared to the pandemic-affected prior year period.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's Regional market share increased by 0.9 points to 39.5%, with gains in Germany, Italy and Poland, partly offset by declines in France and Spain.</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's total shipment volume increased by 4.0% to 193.4 billion units, mainly driven by&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Italy, up by 5.8%, primarily reflecting a higher market share driven by HTUs, as well as a higher total market&#59;</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Poland, up by 17.6%, mainly reflecting the higher total market and a higher market share driven by HTUs&#59; and</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Romania, up by 36.1%. Excluding the net favorable impact of estimated distributor inventory movements, total in-market sales volume increased by 27.3%,</font><font style="color:#ee2724;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">primarily reflecting a higher market share driven by HTUs, as well as the higher total market&#59;</font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 16 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">partly offset by</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">France, down by 8.1%, primarily reflecting a lower total market and a lower market share.</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Fourth-Quarter</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The estimated total market in the EU decreased by 2.2% to 115.4 billion units, mainly due to&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Germany, down by 9.0%, or by 5.9% excluding the net unfavorable impact of estimated trade inventory movements, primarily reflecting the same factors as for the year&#59; and</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">the U.K., down by 16.3%, notably reflecting the same factor as for the year&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">partly offset by</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Poland, up by 5.7%, primarily reflecting higher border sales (largely due to the easing of pandemic-related measures).</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's total shipment volume increased by 3.1% to 46.8 billion units, mainly driven by&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Italy, up by 5.0%, primarily reflecting the same factors as for the year&#59; and</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Poland, up by 13.0%, mainly reflecting the same factors as for the year&#59; </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">partly offset by</font></div><div style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">France, down by 10.3%, primarily reflecting the same factors as for the year.</font></div><div id="if35dd73cdf9149249a054c07087a72f3_64"></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:center"><font style="display:none"></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-top:7pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Net revenues increased by 3.7% on an organic basis, reflecting&#58; a favorable pricing variance, primarily driven by higher combustible tobacco pricing&#59; partly offset by unfavorable volume&#47;mix, mainly due to lower cigarette volume, lower HTU volume and unfavorable cigarette mix.</font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 17 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:7pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">For the year, Russia and Ukraine accounted for around 70% of PMI's total net revenues in the Region. Excluding Russia and Ukraine, net revenues increased by 12.4% on an organic basis, as detailed in Schedule 11.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Operating income decreased by 13.9%, excluding currency and acquisitions, notably reflecting the impact of 2022 charges related to the war in Ukraine.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted operating income decreased by 1.6% on an organic basis, primarily reflecting&#58; unfavorable volume&#47;mix, mainly due to the same factors as for net revenues&#59; higher manufacturing costs (notably related to Ukraine)&#59; and higher marketing, administration and research costs&#59; partly offset by a favorable pricing variance. Adjusted operating income margin decreased by 1.8 points on an organic basis. </font></div><div style="margin-top:7pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Excluding Russia and Ukraine, adjusted operating income and adjusted operating income margin increased by 15.0% and 0.9 points on an organic basis, respectively, as detailed in Schedule 11.</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Fourth-Quarter</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><table style="display:none"></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-top:7pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Net revenues increased by 5.9% on an organic basis, reflecting&#58; a favorable pricing variance, primarily driven by higher combustible tobacco pricing&#59; partly offset by unfavorable volume&#47;mix, mainly due to lower HTU volume and unfavorable cigarette volume&#47;mix.</font></div><div style="margin-top:7pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">For the quarter, Russia and Ukraine accounted for around 72% of PMI's total net revenues in the Region. Excluding Russia and Ukraine, net revenues increased by 12.0% on an organic basis, as detailed in Schedule 11.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Operating income decreased by 15.3%, excluding currency and acquisitions. Adjusted operating income decreased by 14.1% on an organic basis, mainly reflecting&#58; unfavorable volume&#47;mix, primarily due to the same factors as for net revenues&#59; higher marketing, administration and research costs&#59; and higher manufacturing costs&#59; partly offset by a favorable pricing variance. Adjusted operating income margin decreased by 6.3 points on an organic basis.</font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 18 style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Excluding Russia and Ukraine, adjusted operating income increased by 12.0% on an organic basis, while adjusted operating income margin was stable, on the same basis, as detailed in Schedule 11.</font></div><div id="if35dd73cdf9149249a054c07087a72f3_70"></div><div style="margin-top:12pt"><font 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">%</font></td><td colspan="3" 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"></td><td colspan="2" style="background-color:#cceeff;border-top:1pt solid #000000;padding:2px 0 2px 1pt;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">(7.1)</font></td><td style="background-color:#cceeff;border-top:1pt solid #000000;padding:2px 1pt 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">%</font></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Full-Year</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The estimated total market in Eastern Europe decreased by 4.4% to 358.0 billion units, primarily due to&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Russia, down by 3.6%, mainly due to the impact of price increases&#59; and</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Ukraine, down by 18.3%.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The estimated total market in Eastern Europe, excluding Russia and Ukraine, was essentially stable at 113.3 billion units.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's Regional market share decreased by 0.8 points to 29.8%. Excluding Russia and Ukraine, Regional market share increased by 0.4 points to 26.7%.</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's total shipment volume decreased by 7.1% to 106.3 billion units, primarily due to&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Russia, down by 6.0%, due to cigarettes and HTUs&#59; and</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Ukraine, down by 30.1%, due to cigarettes and HTUs.</font></div><div style="margin-top:7pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">During the year, Russia and Ukraine accounted for around 71% of PMI's total shipment volume in the Region. Excluding Russia and Ukraine, total shipment volume increased by 2.7%, as detailed in Appendix 4.</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Fourth-Quarter</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The estimated total market in Eastern Europe decreased, mainly due to&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Russia, down by 1.3%, primarily due to the same factor as in the year&#59; and</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Ukraine, down by 13.7%.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The estimated total market in Eastern Europe, excluding Russia and Ukraine, also decreased.</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's total shipment volume decreased by 6.0% to 26.3 billion units, mainly due to&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Russia, down by 4.3%, due to cigarettes and HTUs&#59; and</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Ukraine, down by 31.6%, due to cigarettes and HTUs.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">During the quarter, Russia and Ukraine accounted for around 71% of PMI's total shipment volume in the Region. Excluding Russia and Ukraine, total shipment volume increased by 3.2%, as detailed in Appendix 4.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="display:none"></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-top:13pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Net revenues increased by 29.0%, excluding currency and acquisitions, partly reflecting a favorable comparison related to the Saudi Arabia customs assessments of $246 million in 2021, shown in &#34;Cost&#47;Other&#34;.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted net revenues increased by 20.1% on an organic basis, as detailed above</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">, mainly </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">reflecting&#58; favorable volume&#47;mix, primarily driven by higher cigarette volume and higher HTU volume&#59; and a favorable pricing variance, mainly driven by combustible tobacco pricing.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Operating income increased by 67.6%, excluding currency and acquisitions. This notably included a favorable comparison related to the Saudi Arabia customs assessments in 2021 (as noted above for net revenues).</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted operating income increased by 37.1% on an organic basis, mainly reflecting&#58; favorable volume&#47;mix, primarily driven by the same factors as for net revenues&#59; a favorable pricing variance&#59; and lower marketing, administration and research costs&#59; partly offset by higher manufacturing costs. Adjusted operating income margin increased by 5.7 points on an organic basis.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 20 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="margin-top:1pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Fourth-Quarter</font></div><div Adjusted operating income decreased by 19.1% on an organic basis, primarily reflecting unfavorable &#34;Cost&#47;Other,&#34; mainly due to higher manufacturing costs, lower fees for certain distribution rights (as for net revenues noted above) and higher marketing, administration and research costs.
